private_information: You can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Your moves must always respect Tower of Hanoi legality: move one disk at a time, only the top disk of a peg can be moved, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Propose a legal, minimal sequence of primitive moves for your controllable disks that helps achieve the global goal configuration while keeping all other disks in legal positions.

private_information: You can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Your moves must always respect Tower of Hanoi legality: move one disk at a time, only the top disk of a peg can be moved, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves only if necessary for the global goal configuration; otherwise, confirm that no moves are required for your controllable disks.

private_information: You integrate the audited move sequence and generate a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver.
Ensure the PDDL reflects two agents with disjoint disk-control capabilities, three pegs, 15 disks with total order A smallest to O largest, the given initial state, and the specified goal state.
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the agents' plans, integrate the auditor's validated move list, and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across the move list to ensure legality, feasibility from the initial state, and satisfaction of the goal state.
You must not rely on bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties; decisions must be justified strictly by Tower of Hanoi rules and the given agent restrictions.
auditor.goal: Validate, correct if necessary, and consolidate the agents' move proposals into a single ordered list that is legal, achieves the goal, and respects agent-specific disk permissions.

public_information: This is a 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest) and three pegs named left, middle, right.
Agent capabilities: agent_1 can move A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 can move I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk of any peg can be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top-to-bottom A, C; right peg is empty.
Required move format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.
reference_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle

local_plan.system_prompt: You generate a legal, minimal sequence of primitive moves for the disks you are allowed to move. Do not produce PDDL. Output only the ordered list using the exact format specified.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance {environment->public_information}. You control disks A through H. Propose an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 that transforms the initial configuration into the goal configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules. Prefer the shortest sequence that achieves the goal.

local_plan.system_prompt: You propose only necessary moves for your allowable disks and otherwise confirm no moves are needed. Do not produce PDDL. Output an ordered list using the exact format specified; if no moves are needed, return an empty list.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance {environment->public_information}. You control disks I through O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 if and only if such moves are necessary to reach the goal; otherwise, return an empty list.

audit_moves.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the proposed move sequences. Enforce Tower of Hanoi rules strictly, ensure that only permitted agents move their respective disks, and verify that the sequence transforms the initial configuration into the goal configuration with right peg empty. Remove duplicates or illegal steps and return a single consolidated ordered list of primitive moves in the exact required format.
audit_moves.prompt: You are the auditor. Verify that the combined moves from agent_1 and agent_2 legally transform the initial state into the goal state described in {environment->public_information}. Ensure every move is valid, only the top disk is moved, larger never on smaller, agent-specific disk permissions are respected, and the final state matches the goal exactly with the right peg empty. Return the corrected and validated ordered list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model a 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with two agents who have disjoint control sets over disks, three pegs, the given initial state, and the specified goal. Encode types for disks and pegs, predicates for on, clear, top, peg, smaller, and optionally capability predicates for agent-disk permissions. Provide a single move action parameterized by agent, disk, source, destination with preconditions enforcing agent capability, top-of-source, clear-of-destination, and smaller-disk constraints. Ensure the problem lists all disks, pegs, agent symbols, initial facts including the total order from smallest to largest, and the exact goal where middle has A on C and left has B on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on M on N on O, and right is empty. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited move sequence {audited_moves} and generate the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. Keep the action schema single and parametric with an agent argument that is constrained by capability predicates. Use typed PDDL with objects for agents, disks, and pegs, and include the full initial and goal configurations exactly as in {environment->public_information}. Output only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the required tags.
